alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 23 at 2:35PM MST until June 23 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 315 PM MST. * At 235 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Estrella Sailport to near Maricopa to Casa Grande, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 170 and 191. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 151 and 170. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 141 and 157. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Maricopa, Bapchule, Estrella Sailport, Olberg, Blackwater, Stanfield, Ak-Chin Village, Sacaton and Santan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
